SEARCH
Package complexClasses

Class ComplexGates

java.lang.Object
complexClasses.ComplexObject
complexClasses.ComplexGates
public class ComplexGates extends ComplexObject
This class provides implementations of several quantum gates in complex form, such as Pauli-X, Pauli-Y, Pauli-Z, and Hadamard gates. It also includes methods to apply these gates to a ComplexQubit and to print these gates.

Quantum gates are represented as ComplexMatrix objects, and the gates provided here are static instances of predefined matrices.

This class supports applying gates to ComplexQubit objects using matrix multiplication.

Example usage: 


 ComplexQubit qubit = new ComplexQubit(new ComplexNumber(1, 0), new ComplexNumber(0, 0)); // Initialize qubit
 ComplexQubit result = ComplexGates.applyPauliX(qubit); // Apply Pauli-X gate
Since:
25 June 2024
Version:
0.1
Author:
Robert Smith

    • applyCNOT

      public static void applyCNOT(ComplexQubit controlQubit, ComplexQubit targetQubit)
      Applies the CNOT gate to control and target qubits. Checks for whether the input is CX 0,1 or CX 1,0. If 1,0 it applies the correct parameter flipping to use the correct CNOT matrix to gain the expected results without using if/else to solve the problem, but instead using the actual matrix math.
      Parameters:
      controlQubit - The control qubit.
      targetQubit - The target qubit.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the qubits are not properly initialized or have incompatible dimensions.
